contextId.information: The words "sincere" and "without offense" mean basically the same thing. Paul combines them to emphasize moral purity. AT: "completely blameless" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

The words "fear" and "trembling" mean basically the same thing. Paul uses them to emphasize reverence before God. AT: "trembling with fear" or "with deep reverence" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
Paul expresses the same idea using both positive and negative words. AT: "completely innocent" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

These two words mean basically the same thing. Paul uses them to emphasize how wicked the generation is. AT: "completely wicked" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
